wikipedia_page.main: William Henry Wylde (1819–1909) was a British civil servant of the Foreign Office, where he was head of the Commercial, Consular, and Slave Trade Departments.

response: Wylde was a member of a Nottinghamshire family, the second son of Gervas Wylde and Catherine née Shudall. He married Eleanor MacCutcheon and they had three sons and three daughters. Eldest son William Henry Wylde (1819–1909) of Chiswick distinguished himself in the Foreign Office.
* William Henry Wylde (1817–unknown), Nova Scotian politician
* William Henry Wylde (civil servant)  (1819–1909), British Foreign Office administrator

William Henry Wylde (February 7, 1817 – ?) was a merchant and political figure in Nova Scotia, Canada. He represented Guysborough County in the Nova Scotia House of Assembly from 1870 to 1875 as a Liberal member.
Tuke married in 1883 Mary Ella Wylde, second daughter of William Henry Wylde.
